contentrichtext.text: '''Industrial Engineering and Operations Research''' ('''IEOR''') is an [[academic]] discipline concerned with making systems more efficient. Often this goal is achieved through the use of [[model (abstract)|modeling]] and other [[Computer|computational]] methods. == See also == *[[Operations research]] *[[Industrial engineering]] *[[Optimization (mathematics)|Optimization]] *[[Logistics]] *[[Applied mathematics]] *[[Mathematical modeling]] *[[Supply chain management]] *[[Statistics]] == External links == *[http://ieor.berkeley.edu/ IEOR at the University of California, Berkeley] *[http://www.ieor.columbia.edu/ IEOR at Columbia University] *[http://www.orie.cornell.edu/ ORIE at Cornell University] *[http://ioe.engin.umich.edu/ IOE at the University of Michigan] *[http://www.me.utexas.edu/~orie/ ORIE at the University of Texas] *[http://www.stanford.edu/dept/MSandE/ Management Science and Engineering at Stanford University] *[http://www.ieor.iitb.ac.in/ IEOR at the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay] *[http://www.nitie.edu/ Operations Management at NITIE , Mumbai] *[http://www.iiie-india.com/IIIE/index.php/ Indian Institution of Industrial Engineering, Bombay] [[Category:Operations research]] [[Category:Industrial engineering]] {{Edu-stub}}
